document_data.caption: The Barrens of Doom and Despair.
document_data.name: Banehold
document_data.basicrefs: {{Cite web|url=http://forums.gleemax.com/showthread.php?t=1072927&page=2|title=The one and only "Ask the Realms authors/designers thread" 4|accessmonthday=January 8th|accessyear=2009|author=[[Richard Baker]]|date=August 12th, 2008}}
document_data.morphic-WT: Alterable morphic. Each divine realm was divinely morphic.
document_data.mainbody: '''Banehold''', sometimes called the '''Barrens of Doom and Despair''', was a sinister plane of existence.
document_data.Description: Banehold was one of a number of [[Outer Planes]]. It was an inhospitable locale, filled with vast deserts of black sand and huge plains of dark [[granite]]. There was no water to be found anywhere on the plane (except for the [[River of Blood]]), and no sunlight filled the blood-red sky.
document_data.Inhabitants: Deities who made their home on this plane included [[Bane]], [[Beshaba]], [[Hoar]], [[Loviatar]], and [[Talona]]. [[Kuraulyek]] dwelled in this plane's [[Underdark]].
document_data.Structure: The Barrens of Doom and Despair consisted of a single infinite plane in Gehenna. There were no constituent layers. It linked via the [[Astral Plane]] to the planes of the [[Prime Material Plane|Prime Material]] (such as [[Toril]]) and a number of portals directly connected it with [[Hammergrim]] and the [[Blood Rift]]. Beshaba's realm, the [[Blood Tor]], linked directly to the [[Abyss]].
